_header: Most prepotent prince of power imperial
Subjects: York; Henry VII; occasional verse; historical verse
_description: Address of Welcome to Henry VII at York (1486) at the Common Hall — three stanzas rhyme royal

YorkCity6.First Lines:
Most prepotent prince of power ImperiallRedowtid in ich region of
                    Cristes affiance…
YorkCity6.Last Lines:
…Which causid moost this Citie to be resolateNow reviving in
                    comforth to attaine your asstate

BLCottJulBXII.First Lines:
Moost prepotent prince of power ImperiallRedoubtede in Iche Region
                    of Cristez affiance…
BLCottJulBXII.Last Lines:
…Whiche causede moost this citie to bee desolateNow Reviuyng
                    in comforte to Atteigne your Astate
BLCottJulBXII.Note:
‘Dauid’ written in the right margin (f. 12). Folio number
                    reflects the most recent foliation.

Smith,  A. H.
